sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alyssa Holland)
articles.description: Range inputs have notoriously been a pain to style. Each browser renders the input differently requiring you to use vendor prefixes in order to create a cohesive look and feel. In this article, we’ll take a look at the quirkiness of the HTML range input and demonstrate how to style the input to look consistent across all major browsers.
articles.title: Creating A Custom Range Input That Looks Consistent Across All Browsers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: A meaningful user experience is what can set your site apart from others. But what makes an experience truly meaningful? And how to achieve that? The tools, tips, and resources in this post not only help you to come up with a UX strategy that works for you and your team but also to circumvent potential UX pitfalls.
articles.title: Useful UX Guidelines, Tools And Resources

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Barry Pollard)
articles.description: How to improve Core Web Vitals, a Smashing Magazine case study on how we detected and fixed the bottlenecks, and how we ended up with green scores, all the way.
articles.title: Improving Core Web Vitals, A Smashing Magazine Case Study

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Babich & Gleb Kuznetsov)
articles.description: Modern HMIs are transforming the way we interact with our vehicles. A car becomes a gadget that we use in a similar way as we use our phones. Users expect a lot of HMI, they even evaluate car experience based on the experience they have with HMI. In this article, let’s look at some ways to help us satisfy users’ needs with proper design.
articles.title: Designing Human-Machine Interfaces For Vehicles Of The Future

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nwani Victory)
articles.description: In every software-as-a-service solution, user billing and payments are key aspects in the sale of services rendered. Let’s learn about Stripe and how the REST API can be programmatically used in serverless functions to manage the billing for an application.
articles.title: Billing Management For Your Next SaaS Idea Using Stripe And Azure Functions

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Steven Hoober)
articles.description: Before we can talk about how people interact, much less how to take advantage of that knowledge and design, it’s important to understand a bit about the history, the technology, and what today counts as a mobile touchscreen device at all.
articles.title: Touch Design For Mobile Interfaces: Defining Mobile Devices (Excerpt)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nafees Nehar)
articles.description: To be able to modify headers in a testing environment is a great thing to have. It allows control over your application as one can bypass authentication, set cookies, and so on. In this article, Nafees Nehar explores some methods which allow modification of headers in an automation testing setup.
articles.title: Modifying Headers In HTTP(s) Requests In UI Automation Testing

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Everybody loves a nice freebie, right? To get you in the mood for the upcoming holidays, we collected some winter- and holiday-themed icon sets and vector elements that you can use in your projects for free. Enjoy!
articles.title: Free Christmas Icon Sets And Vector Elements

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Slava Shestopalov)
articles.description: There are so many websites out there that have not considered the overall usability of their visually impaired users. When it comes to designing better links and sending better emails, Slava Shestopalov has a few tips on how to improve your website’s experience while accessibility in mind.
articles.title: Designing Better Links For Websites And Emails: A Guideline

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Iris Lješnjanin)
articles.description: Are you ready for the countdown to Christmas? From [festive](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2016/12/freebie-christmas-advent-icon-set-25-icons-ai-eps-svg-png-pdf/) [icon](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2015/12/freebie-christmas-icons-illustrations/) [sets](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2014/11/freebie-christmas-icon-set-ai-psd-eps-pdf-svg-png/) to advent calendars that are bound to sweeten your days with a delightful little surprise each morning, we’ve decided to join in on this lovely annual tradition and bring it all to one place. So prepare yourself a nice cup of coffee and get cozy — there’s always something new to learn and discover!
articles.title: Advent Calendars For Web Designers And Developers (December 2021 Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Caleb Olojo)
articles.description: There’s a great challenge that comes with building Jamstack applications on the web. In this article, Caleb Olojo explains how you can use Next.js to bootstrap your app safely.
articles.title: How To Protect Your API Key In Production With Next.js API Route

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we’re asking if changes to best practises over the last year have negatively impacted the web. Is it all downhill from here? Drew McLellan talks to expert Chris Ferdinandi to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 44 With Chris Ferdinandi: Is The Web Dead?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let’s welcome December with some new wallpapers! Designed by artists and designers from across the globe, they are available with and without a calendar for the month. Enjoy!
articles.title: It’s That Time Of The Year (December 2021 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: One of Jhey’s main mantras is to make learning fun.  In this article, he shows you ways to level up your skills by bringing your ideas to life, and not forgetting that [you can be playful with code](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/11/playfulness-code-supercharge-fun-learning/). With that mindset, every idea is bound to become an opportunity to try something new.
articles.title: 3D CSS Flippy Snaps With React And GreenSock

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nirmalya Ghosh)
articles.description: In this article, Nirmalya discusses some of the complex problems that he faced while building and maintaining large Next.js applications. He always explains how these problems can be solved by using various tools.
articles.title: How To Maintain A Large Next.js Application

articles.description: Last Thursday, a vulnerability was disclosed in the Log4J logging library affecting many Java applications worldwide.  The vulnerability is called Log4Shell (CVE-2021–44228). It allows an attacker to inject a crafted payload anywhere in the requests that get parsed and executed by the vulnerable application. There are a lot of
articles.title: Java Log4JShell Vulnerability – What I Learned About it This Week

articles.title: Learn to Code RPG – Full Soundtrack + How I Made It

articles.title: SVG + JavaScript Tutorial – How to Code an Animated Watch

articles.description: Gone are the days when Linux and Windows were like two opposing forces. articles.title: How to Dual Boot Any Linux Distribution With Windows – and Get Rid of It When You Need To

articles.description: Binary trees are one of the most complicated data structures out there. And one of the reasons they're so difficult is that it's hard to actually visualize them in a simple way. In this tutorial, I'll show you how to create your own BinaryTreeViewer which will allow you to watch
articles.title: How to Create a BinaryTreeViewer using C#, CSS, & HTML (Code & Algorithm Walkthrough)

articles.description: An eternity ago in the year of 2012, a few Stanford professors decided to make their courses freely available online.  The media christened these courses "MOOCs" – Massive Open Online Courses. And they hailed 2012 as "Year of the MOOC." Now, a decade later, the MOOC ecosystem has reached 220M learners
articles.title: The Top 100 Free University Courses of the Year (Ranked by Popularity)

articles.description: If you work with WordPress, then you know just how important a good stack of plugins is. They were designed to improve everything from media handling, and basic features to security and more.  You can have as many as you like, in theory, but don't go overboard. A good rule
articles.title: Best WordPress Plugins – 15 Tools to Boost Your Productivity

articles.title: Learn to Code RPG – A Visual Novel Video Game Where you Learn Computer Science Concepts

articles.description: I recently attended a training session with the Auth0 Dev Rel team to learn about a cool new feature called Auth0 Actions.  In this article, I am going to explain what Auth0 Actions are, why you'd want to use them, and how to set one up. What are Auth0 Actions?
articles.title: How to Extend Your Login Flow With Auth0 Actions
